job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: ltpgtltstronggtsoftware engineerltstronggtltpgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtfreewill is an awardwinning socialgood startup that has raised more than billion for high impact nonprofits since we were founded in weve been featured in the new york times forbes oprahs magazine and have even been named to town ampamp countrys top philanthropists listltpgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtall of this is because weve figured out how to make some powerful but complicated ways to donate much easier and more accessible our products make things easier for the donors who want to change the world and for nonprofits doing heroic work around the planetltpgtltpgtin the last years weve grown from people to all smart tenacious and kind and continue to grow quickly wed love to have you be a part of this adventureltpgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtltstronggtjob descriptionltstronggtltpgtltpgtwe are looking for an ambitious software engineer who wants to make impact at a missiondriven companyltpgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtthis role can be remote or based out of new york city competitive comp ampamp equity flexible start date unfortunately we cant sponsor hbs at this features for freewill web applicationsltligtltligtlearn and grow in a collaborative environment sharing knowledge through code reviews pair programming conversations and broader team trainingsltligtltligtinteract closely with a diverse team across legal growth design and productltligtltligtcontribute ideas to improve our product technology and team practicesltligtltligtgain knowledge of endoflife planning and nonprofit fundraising what currently is working what is not and what tech can do to help fix itltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgttechnical skillsltpgtltulgtltligt years professional experienceltligtltligtbachelors degree in computer science or related technical field or equivalent training fellowship or work experienceltligtltligtfamiliarity with databases api design automated testing debugging and web front endsltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtother important traitsltpgtltulgtltligtintense curiosityltligtltligtscrappiness and gritltligtltligtfocus on continuous learningltligtltligtcomfort with ambiguityltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtbenefitsltpgtltpgtin addition to helping raise t for high impact nonprofits and a kind and joyful work environment full time employees at freewill are eligible for the following benefitsltpgtltulgtltligtwork from homeltligtltligt monthly stipend to outfit your home office or cover utility billsltligtltligtunlimited ptoltligtltligtstaff holidays and freedays periodic one day office closures to rest and refreshltligtltligtcompany stock optionsltligtltligtkltligtltligtmedicaldentalvision some single coverage medical plans are employer paid subsidized rates for spousal parentchild and family coverageltligtltligtfree one medical membershipltligtltligtpaid parental leaveltligtltligtbook policy well cover any reasonably priced books that will make you better at your job ie how to excel in sales or improve the freewill community ie books on antiracismltligtltulgtltpgtltbrgtltpgtltpgtfreewill is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity we are committed to finding talent that is not determined on the basis of race religion color national origin gender sexual orientation age marital status veteran status or disability statusltpgtltpgtwe are a remotefirst company thats able to hire in states and dc unfortunately we are unable to hire in colorado alabama or louisiana at this time we also cant sponsor working visas so all applicants will need to have work authorization in the usltpgtltpgtexcited about our mission success in serving nonprofit partners requires our dedication to building a diverse equitable and inclusive team we encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and all walks of life to apply we cant wait to learn with and from youltpgt
